title: Sex and the Body An invaluable starting point is Caroline Bynum, “Why All the Fuss about the Body? A Medievalist’s Perspective

The subject of the sexual body in Antiquity is so pervasive that it is found in a wide variety of texts on medicine, literature, culture, religion and politics. It is impossible to give a complete bibliography for the subject, but highly recommended in light of the topics addressed in this collection are the following: Helen King, Hippocrates’ Woman
